publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 05:54

did.unittitle: British Caribbean Documents

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: A collection of manuscript deeds, wills, leases, letters, and other legal and financial documents concerning eighteenth- and nineteenth-century estates and plantations on islands in the British West Indies.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source unknown. Possibly formerly owned by James Coleman, genealogical and antiquarian manuscripts vendor, London.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by island and chronologically thereunder.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Most of the manuscripts are listed in Volumes II and III of Vere Langford Oliver's six-volume compendium Caribbeana, being Miscellaneous Papers Related to the History, Genealogy, Topography, and Antiquities of the British West Indies (London: Mitchell Hughes and Clarke, 1910-1919). Footnotes in those volumes associate the documents with James Coleman, a dealer who specialized in genealogical and antiquarian manuscripts active in London and Tottenham from 1862 to 1905; most of the documents have printed descriptions clipped from a sales catalogue attached to their versos.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: British Caribbean Documents. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
Former call numbers: Z117 00198 and ZZ117 5

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of manuscript deeds, wills, leases, letters, and other legal and financial documents concerning eighteenth- and nineteenth-century estates and plantations on fourteen islands in the British West Indies: Antigua, Barbados, Dominica, Grenada, Carriacou, Haiti, Jamaica, Nevis, New Providence, Saint Christopher (Saint Kitts), Saint Vincent, Tobago, Tortola, and Trinidad. Prominent among the landowners represented in the collection are Clotworthy Upton, Lord Templetown, who owned estates on Grenada, and Christopher Bethell Codrington of, who owned Clare Hall on Antigua. Several of the documents in the collection include references to, or contain schedules of, slaves on the estates. Most of the manuscripts are listed in Volumes II and III of Caribbeana, edited by Vere Langford Oliver, and have printed descriptions clipped from a sales catalogue attached to their versos.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The British Caribbean Documents is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

did.unittitle: Accounts of estates under the management of Robert Orme, 1795-1799
Fair copy of two letters from Thomson Hankey of London, to Richard Mauly of Grenada

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding production of sugar and movement of slaves on the plantations.

did.unittitle: Sketch of Lord Templetown's Account, prepared by Thomson Hankey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Mr. Hankey's statement of the Grenada property."

did.unittitle: Account of the extent and history of the Grande Bras, St. Cloud, and Chantilly estates in the parish of St. Andrew

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An historical account starts with the deaths of Peter Simond (1785) and John Hankey (1792), with a description and accounting of slaves, pounds of sugar, and gallons of rum produced 1800-1818; includes an "Abstract from the Register of Slaves"; signed by James McNure. Accompanied by a letter from [Thomas?] Bridgewater to William Wilkinson of London, dated March 15, 1819.

did.unittitle: Note of the late Lord Templetown's account in Thomson Hankey's hand
Accounts of Grande Bras estate current to the 30th April 1820, signed by Thomson Hankey
Lease indenture between William Johnstone, late of Grenada now Paris, and John Ross, late of Grenada now of Aberdeen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Relating to the coffee plantation Granton, formerly known as Colebrook, , in the parish of St. George. Appended is a schedule of the estate's 119 slaves listing each name, age, colour, country of origin, and conspicuous marks or physical condition.

did.unittitle: Lease between Samuel Amy Severne, of Northampton County, and George Edward Anson of London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For the estate New Hampshire in the parish of St. George.

did.unittitle: Accounts of Grand Bras, St. Cloud Chantilly estates, current to 30th April 1839, prepared by Thomson Hankey
Accounts of Grand Bras, St. Cloud Chantilly estates, current to the 30th April 1842, prepared by Thomson Hankey

Abstract of the title of Anthony Percy Upton, Mary Howard, James Singleton, and Sophia Upton to their share of the Grand Bras Estate under the will of Lord Templetown, and agreed to be sold to Thomson Hankey

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Regarding Bellair, a cotton plantation; seals of all parties.

did.unittitle: Haiti

Jamaica
Six letters and notes relating to the Booth, Barrett, Mason, and Pye families, who had estates in Jamaica

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters from Edward Booth to John Holliday, John Thomson Mason to Charles Pye, and Charles Pye to John Thomson Mason, regarding Booth family wills and estates.

did.unittitle: Appellants case between Henry Thomas Broughton and Phillis Roper Broughton, and Elizabeth Jackson and others, the creditors of Charles Kelsall, Esq.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Report of a law case which recites deed of 1776 between Charles Kelsall and Rebecca his wife of the 1st part and George Clarke, Esq., and Susannah his wife, daughter of Charles Kelsall, by which one third was settled on the Clarkes; Thomas Stephen and Rose Fuller, of the City of London, are mentioned largely in this case, and the plantations are in the parish of St. Mary in Jamaica. Report printed in London by Sabine and Son of, Shoe Lane.

did.unittitle: Accounts of Samuel Hilton concerning Bounty Hall Sugar Plantation covering 1827-1830
Nevis
Lease between Anne, David, and Richard Gardner, all of Nevis, and Alexandra Houston, John Clerk, William Crichton, William McDowall, all of City of London

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: For a plantation, Rawlins's Land, in the parish of St. James; lists names of slaves included with the property. Seals of Anne and David Gardner.

did.unittitle: Tobago
Deed between the devisees of John Walker and John Anderson et al.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Conveyance of the Providence Plantation on Tobago to a term of 1,000 years. Indenture of fifteen parchment sheets; fourteen seals of all parties.

Parties include Joanna Thomson, Andrew Hunter, Thomas Davidson (formerly Thomas Randall) of Edinburgh; James, Margaret, and Jane Walker of Edinburgh; John Anderson of Tobago; Christopher William Irvine of Bath; and many others.

did.unittitle: Deed between John and Janet Learmont, of Dumfries, and John Learmont Jr. to sell slaves and land

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a schedule of slaves with name, age, colour, country, and "usual employment," with seals of John and Janet Learmont.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
